componentsMeta.description:
A visual placeholder for an element while it is in a loading state.

The data for your components might not be immediately available. You can improve the perceived responsiveness of the page by using skeletons. It feels like things are happening immediately, then the information is incrementally displayed on the screen.

This component can be used to create skeletons for various types of content, such as images or profiles.

You can use this component directly or use the specific use case components: SkeletonPhoto, SkeletonProfile, SkeletonRectangular, SkeletonText, SkeletonThumbnail, SkeletonCircular.
componentsMeta.name: Skeleton

usage.description: This example shows a skeleton loading state for an image but can be used for any element.

componentsMeta.description: Navigation tool that organizes content across different screens and views.
componentsMeta.name: TabGroup

componentsMeta.description:
A component that allows users to input large amounts of text that could span multiple lines.

This component gives you a textarea HTML element that automatically adjusts its height to match the length of the content within maximum and minimum rows. A character counter when a maxLength is set to show the number of characters remaining below the limit.
componentsMeta.name: Textarea

componentsMeta.description: A text component that applies the correct font styles based on the variant and size. variant
componentsMeta.name: Txt

componentsMeta.description: A clickable component that allows users to perform an action, make a choice or trigger a change in state.
componentsMeta.name: Button

componentsMeta.description: Modals display important information that users need to acknowledge. They appear over the interface and block further interactions until an action is selected. Modal is a wrapper around the Dialog component that provides a header and footer for the dialog.
componentsMeta.name: Modal

componentsMeta.description: A visual placeholder for an text while it is in a loading state.
componentsMeta.name: SkeletonText

usage.description: This example shows a skeleton loading state for some text but can be used for any element.

componentsMeta.description: An avatar is a visual representation of a user or entity. It can be used to display an initials, icon, or image.
componentsMeta.name: Avatar

usage.description: The image if provided is displayed first, followed by the icon if provided, and finally the initials. If no initials are provided, the first two letters of the name will be used as initials.

componentsMeta.description:
A hybrid interactive component that is used frequently to organize content and offers a wide range of control and navigation in most experiences.

With its flexible and simple structure, the list item element is core and can meet the needs of many uses cases.

The ListItem has three main elements: leading element, label, and trailing element.

Leading elements may be one of the following [Icon](/icons), Img, Avatar.

Trailing elements may be one of the following [Icon](/icons), Checkbox, ListItemButton, Radio, Switch, Tag, Txt.

The ListItemButton is a more limited Button with context specific options.
componentsMeta.name: ListItem

componentsMeta.description: A container housing a simple list of options presented to the customer to select one option at a time.
componentsMeta.name: Menu

componentsMeta.description: A field element that allows users to select one option from a list of available choices. *
componentsMeta.name: Select

componentsMeta.description: Dynamically generated options that are suggested to the user as responses or prompts.
componentsMeta.name: ChipUtility

utilitiesMeta.description: A hook that creates a timeout that is automatically cleared when the component is unmounted.
utilitiesMeta.name: useTimeout

properties.name: variant
properties.description: The variant of the skeleton that best hints the content being loaded.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the skeleton. This is ignored when variant is 'profile' or 'thumbnail'.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the skeleton. This is ignored when variant is 'profile' or 'thumbnail'.

properties.name: children
properties.description:
The content of the skeleton.

When the value is undefined, null or false the skeleton will appear.

If the value is provided, the skeleton will not appear and the content will be displayed instead.

properties.name: count
properties.description:
The content of the badge. If larger than 99, the badge will display '99+'. If null or undefined, the badge will
be hidden.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the badge.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: The color variant of the badge.

properties.name: surfaceBorder
properties.description: Whether the badge should have a border that matches the surface color.

properties.name: children
properties.description:
The context for which the badge is applied.

Could be a button, link, or any other element that the badge is associated with.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label of the call to action button.

properties.name: onClick
properties.description: The callback function for the call to action button.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the call to action button.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The id of the element. If not provided one will be generated.

properties.description: Marks the element as active and displays active state theme.

properties.description: The content of the element.

properties.description: The size of the element.

properties.description: Determines if the element is [disabled](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/disabled).

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description: Determines if the element is [readonly](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/readonly).

properties.description: The [name](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#name) of the control.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description:
Marks the element as invalid and displays error state theme.

If the errorMessage is empty the error state theme will not appear.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description:
Marks the element as invalid and displays error message.

When an element is invalid it must display an error message explaining why it is invalid.

typesMeta.description:
The props that are common to input elements.

If an element is invalid it must have an errorMessage.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label of the option. This is the text that will be displayed on the option.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Determines if the element is [disabled](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/disabled).

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the option. If not provided, the label will be used as the value.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The the icon to display before the label.

properties.name: iconActive
properties.description: The icon to display before the label when the option is active.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label of the tab. This is the text that will be displayed on the tab.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Determines if the element is [disabled](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/disabled).

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The value of the tab sent to onChange when selected.

If not provided, the label will be used as the value.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The icon to display on the left side of the tab.

properties.name: iconActive
properties.description: The icon to display on the left side of the tab when the tab is active.

properties.name: badge
properties.description: The badge count to display on the tab

properties.name: options
properties.description:
The tabs to display. Each tab has a label and an optional leading icon.

Minimum of two tab options are required. Maximum of seven tab options are ideal.
properties.example:
[
{ value: '1', label: 'Option 1' },
{ value: '2', label: 'Disabled 2 ', disabled: true },
{ value: '3', label: 'Option 3' },
]

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the selected tab.

properties.name: onChange
properties.description: The function to call when the tab is clicked.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the tabs.

properties.name: width
properties.description: When 'fill' the options will fill the width of the container. When 'hug', the options will be as wide as their content.

properties.name: showTrail
properties.description: When width is 'hug' this determines if the trailing underline should be showing. When width is 'fill' this property isn't applicable.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Determines if the element is [required](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/required).

properties.name: placement
properties.description:
The preferred placement of the floating element.

This determines where the floating element will be positioned relative to the reference element.

properties.name: arrowRef
properties.description: A ref object for the arrow element.

properties.name: strategy
properties.description:
The positioning strategy ('absolute' or 'fixed').

When set to 'fixed', the floating element will be positioned relative to the viewport.

When set to 'absolute', the floating element will be positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor.

properties.name: offsetOptions
properties.description: The offset options for the floating element.

properties.name: refWidth
properties.description:
When set to true, the width of the floating element will match the width of the reference element.

When set to an HTMLElement, the width of the floating element will match the width of that HTMLElement.

properties.name: hide
properties.description: Whether to hide the floating element.

properties.description: The id of the element. If not provided one will be generated.

properties.name: hideVariants
properties.description:
True to hide all or a list of variants to hide.

Helpful for hiding variants that can have unexpected collisions with the other examples.

properties.name: presets
properties.description:
This is used to set the initial propState of the component.

Specifically to highlight certain features of the component.

properties.name: defaultState
properties.description:
This is used to set the initial propState of the component before any preset propState is applied.

Specifically to highlight certain features of the component.

properties.name: render
properties.description:
The component to render in the example.

By default, this will be the component that is being documented.

If you only need to update the props of the component, you can use renderProps.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The name of the preset. This is used to display the preset in the UI.

properties.name: propState
properties.description: The props of the component. This is used to set props of the component. These values can't be changed in the UI.

properties.name: isDefault
properties.description: Determines if the preset is the default preset. This is used to set the initial propState of the component.

properties.description: A function which returns additional ListItem props to apply to each ListItem.

properties.name: isMulti
properties.description: Whether the listbox allows multiple selections.

properties.name: selectAll
properties.description:
The label for the "Select All" option.

Ignored if `isMulti` is false.

If `isMulti` is `true`, defaults to "Select All". If a string, it will be used as the label. If false the select
all option will not be rendered.

properties.name: onChange
properties.description: The function to call when the selected values change.

properties.name: children
properties.description:
The children of the listbox added after the items.

Usually only used for showing no items found.

properties.description: The number of items to display in the listbox

properties.description: The id of the element. If not provided one will be generated.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Determines if the element is [disabled](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/disabled).

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the element.

properties.name: aria-label
properties.description: The aria-label for the element.

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description: Determines if the element is [readonly](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/readonly).

properties.name: invalid
properties.description:
Marks the element as invalid and displays error state theme.

If the errorMessage is empty the error state theme will not appear.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description:
Marks the element as invalid and displays error message.

When an element is invalid it must display an error message explaining why it is invalid.

properties.name: itemDisplayCount
properties.description: The number of items to display in the listbox

properties.name: listItemProps
properties.description: A function which returns additional ListItem props to apply to each ListItem.

properties.name: isMulti
properties.description: Whether the listbox allows multiple selections.

properties.name: selectAll
properties.description:
The label for the "Select All" option.

Ignored if `isMulti` is false.

If `isMulti` is `true`, defaults to "Select All". If a string, it will be used as the label. If false the select
all option will not be rendered.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Array of options to display in the select
properties.example:
[
{ value: '1', label: 'Option 1' },
{ value: '2', label: 'Option 2' },
{ value: '3', label: 'Option 3' },
{ value: '4', label: 'Option 4' },
{ value: '5', label: 'Option 5' },
{ value: '6', label: 'Option 6' },
{ value: '7', label: 'Option 7' },
{ value: '8', label: 'Option 8' },
{ value: '9', label: 'Option 9' },
{ value: '10', label: 'Option 10' },
]

properties.name: value
properties.description: Array of selected values

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Placeholder for the select

properties.name: placement
properties.description: The placement of the select menu. Will be ignored if the menu is too close to the edge of the screen.

properties.name: style
properties.description: The style of the select.

properties.name: onChange
properties.description: The function to call when the selected values change.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Determines if the element is [disabled](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/disabled).

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description: Determines if the element is [readonly](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/readonly).

properties.name: invalid
properties.description:
Marks the element as invalid and displays error state theme.

If the errorMessage is empty the error state theme will not appear.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description:
Marks the element as invalid and displays error message.

When an element is invalid it must display an error message explaining why it is invalid.

properties.name: placement
properties.description:
The preferred placement of the floating element.

This determines where the floating element will be positioned relative to the reference element.

properties.name: offsetOptions
properties.description: The offset options for the floating element.

properties.name: refWidth
properties.description:
When set to true, the width of the floating element will match the width of the reference element.

When set to an HTMLElement, the width of the floating element will match the width of that HTMLElement.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Is the chip disabled.

properties.name: flat
properties.description: Is the chip elevated or flat. If flat the drop shadow is removed.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label of the chip.

properties.name: onClick
properties.description: The function to call when the chip is clicked.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Whether the chip is currently selected.

properties.name: leadingIcon
properties.description: The leading icon of the chip.

properties.name: trailingIcon
properties.description: The trailing icon of the chip.
